Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/bitcode/lib/bitcode/reader/bitcodereader-cpp/#l00616">616</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/bitcode/lib/bitcode/reader/bitcodereader-cpp">BitcodeReader.cpp</a>.

### BackwardRefFunctions {#a2ab54c0fc4e8c70368e0420e1d17e484}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>std::vector&lt;Function &#42;&gt; anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;BitcodeReader.cpp&#125;::BitcodeReader::BackwardRefFunctions</>}>
These are Functions that contain BlockAddresses which refer a different <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function">Function</a>.

When parsing the different <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function">Function</a>, queue Functions that refer to the different <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function">Function</a>. Those Functions must be materialized in order to resolve their <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/blockaddress">BlockAddress</a> constants before the different <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function">Function</a> gets moved into another <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/module">Module</a>.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/bitcode/lib/bitcode/reader/bitcodereader-cpp/#l00679">679</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/bitcode/lib/bitcode/reader/bitcodereader-cpp">BitcodeReader.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### UseRelativeIDs {#a6a9b358b61a45d06d1d43fa09f933f1c}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;BitcodeReader.cpp&#125;::BitcodeReader::UseRelativeIDs = false</>}>
Indicates that we are using a new encoding for instruction operands where most operands in the current FUNCTION&#95;BLOCK are encoded relative to the instruction number, for a more compact encoding.

Some instruction operands are not relative to the instruction <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#abdf8cf606905c10634e831390981b0ed">ID</a>: basic block numbers, and types. Once the old style function blocks have been phased out, we would not need this flag.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/bitcode/lib/bitcode/reader/bitcodereader-cpp/#l00687">687</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/bitcode/lib/bitcode/reader/bitcodereader-cpp">BitcodeReader.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### VirtualTypeIDs {#a025c835a9e61292a2c3a02f8b8361ab5}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>DenseMap&lt;std::pair&lt;Type &#42;, unsigned&gt;, unsigned&gt; anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;BitcodeReader.cpp&#125;::BitcodeReader::VirtualTypeIDs</>}>
In some cases, we need to create a type <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#abdf8cf606905c10634e831390981b0ed">ID</a> for a type that was not explicitly encoded in the bitcode, or we don&#39;t know about at the current point.

For example, a global may explicitly encode the value type <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#abdf8cf606905c10634e831390981b0ed">ID</a>, but not have a type <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#abdf8cf606905c10634e831390981b0ed">ID</a> for the pointer to value type, for which we create a virtual type <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#abdf8cf606905c10634e831390981b0ed">ID</a> instead. This map stores the new type <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#abdf8cf606905c10634e831390981b0ed">ID</a> that was created for the given pair of <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> and contained type <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#abdf8cf606905c10634e831390981b0ed">ID</a>.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/bitcode/lib/bitcode/reader/bitcodereader-cpp/#l00611">611</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/bitcode/lib/bitcode/reader/bitcodereader-cpp">BitcodeReader.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
